simulate_scan¶

Simulate discovery observations with user-defined scan pattern.

OLD DOC:

  • Can simulate beampark detections
  • Detections of fence-style scanning
  • Output simulated IOD measurements
simulate_scan.find_n(t0, t1, o, max_dpos=100.0)[source]¶
simulate_scan.get_iod(o, tx, rxs, res1, dt=1.0, plott=False)[source]¶

Calculate the peak SNR for detection for each transmit-receiver pair.

simulate_scan.get_iods(o, radar, sim_t0, sim_t1, eval_gain=False, logger=None)[source]¶

Find passes of an object between sim_t0 and sim_t1. If eval_gain is True, we report the time when gain is maximized.

simulate_scan.get_pass(o, t0, tx, el_thresh=30.0)[source]¶

Determine when the object goes below the horizon.

simulate_scan.get_passes0(o, tx, t0=0, t1=86400.0, max_dpos=100.0, min_angle=50, max_dt=3600, plott=False, z_ang_thresh=80.0, eval_gain=False, follow_target=False, logger=None)[source]¶

Do a grid search for closest on-axis position of an object o. This is used to find detections of an object. We take into account the scan pattern of the radar

Can use either minimum on-axis angle or maximum gain of TX antenna as selection criteria for returning a candidate detection.

simulate_scan.pp_det(det_times)[source]¶

Function to pretty print detection times list returned by the simulate_scan.get_iods() function.

Parameters:det_times (list) – List of dictionaries generated by get_iods.
